author: Mara Gay
title: Majority of Heating Technicians for NYC Housing Agency Aren’t Certified, Monitor Says
text:
More than half of the heating technicians in the New York City Housing Authority aren’t certified by the city’s fire department to do the work, according to a monitor at the agency appointed by Mayor Bill de Blasio.
Edna Wells Handy, acting chief compliance officer at the housing authority, said that of 277 heating technicians, 147 have either expired certifications or no certifications from the Fire Department of New York for oil-burner operators.
...
